content: be simple shawl tis a gift to be simple variation on a shaker song though life may often seem complex i value simplicity in most things be simple is an asymmetrical triangular shawl that is simple to knit and simple to wear it is knit in simple garter stitch with a picot bind-off on one side the hypotenuse of the triangle is more of a slight crescent- moon curve than a straight line the shawl can be knit in a variety of yarn weights with the appropriate needle size to create your desired drape circular needles work best to accommodate the ever increasing number of stitches in most cases the shawls required 400-450 yards of yarn this is a perfect one-skein project for many fingering and sock weight yarns i have knit be simple in fingering to worsted weight yarns with lovely results the shawl is long enough to be wrapped and tied around your neck as a cozy scarf or to be draped more loosely for a bit of summer evening warmth the tomato red shawl is knit with green mountain spinnery simply fine the blue shawl is knit with string theory hand dyed yarn bluestocking once you learn the picot bind-off this would be a good pattern for a beginning knitter suggested yarns green mountain spinnery simply fine one skein size 6 needles malabrigo yarn twist two skeins size 9 needles swans island natural colors merino worsted two skeins size 8 needles string theory hand dyed yarn bluestocking or caper sock one skein size 5 needles the plucky knitter primo aran two skeins size 8 needles gauge 18 sts and 42 row = 4 in garter stitch with fingering weight yarn 15 sts and 34 row = 4 in garter stitch with worsted weight yarn i have knit be simple with the above yarns and needles sizes i tend to be a loose knitter please adjust your needle size to your yarn to create the drape that is most pleasing to you for best results knit a test gauge and wet block to determine the extent to which your yarn will bloom after soaking the finished shawl will be more or less dense depending upon the combination of yarn needle size and your own unique knitting style finished size 11-13 inches deep 60-72 inches long my blocking was minimal to maintain the cushy feeling of unblocked garter stitch pattern cast on 3 stitches row 1 knit one front and back knit 2 stitches row 2 knit until one stitch remains knit one front and back row 3 knit one front and back knit until two stitches remain knit two together row 4 knit until one stitch remains knit one front and back repeat row 3 and 4 until shawl is the desired size and sufficient yarn remains for a picot bind-off ending with row 4 the picot bind-off requires significantly more yarn than a regular bind off would use picot bind-off *cast on 2 stitches with knitting on
